sen.e: Taneyoshi wanted to install Zengyo, the biological child between his wife, who had become a priestess following the violent death of Sanetomo, and Yoriie, as Shogun but Mitora from Sekkan-ke (line of regents and advisors) was brought in to succeed the post of Shogun by the scheming Regent Hojo family and Zengyo was murdered.

sen.e: In May 1221, when the retired Emperor Gotoba raised an army, during the council of war, Taneyoshi optimistically stated, "Now that he has become an enemy of the court, not even thousand people will support Yoshitoki HOJO."

sen.e: Taneyoshi attempted to put up one last fight at the palace of the retired Emperor but was turned away with the palace gate being closed and, instead, an inzen (a decree from the retired Emperor) was issued to arrest the tactician Taneyoshi who set off a war.

sen.e: Taneyoshi and the remaining samurai of the Kyoto side barricaded themselves in To-ji Temple but, being under attack by Yoshimura's army, after fighting bravely along with his sons Tanetsura and Keneyoshi, Taneyoshi killed himself in Nishiyama Kijima (Uzumasa, Ukyo-ku, Kyoto City).
